Uses of Class
com.mwdiamond.fansi.Ansi

    • Uses of Ansi in com.mwdiamond.fansi

      Methods in com.mwdiamond.fansi that return Ansi 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Ansi Ansi.ansi()
      Constructs a new Ansi instance configured for the current environment.
      Ansi AnsiForTests.ansi()
      Construct an Ansi instance associated with the stdout and stderr used by this AnsiForTests instance.
      Ansi AnsiFactory.ansi()
      Constructs a new Ansi instance as specified by this factory implementation.
      Ansi Ansi.background(Ansi.Color background, Ansi.Style... styles)
      Sets the background color, and optionally the style(s), of the next block of text to display.
      Ansi Ansi.background(java.awt.Color background, Ansi.Style... styles)
      Sets the background color, and optionally the style(s), of the next block of text to display.
      Ansi Ansi.background(int backgroundIndex, Ansi.Style... styles)
      Sets the background color, and optionally the style(s), of the next block of text to display.
      Ansi Ansi.color(Ansi.Color color, Ansi.Color background, Ansi.Font font, Ansi.Style... styles)
      Sets the color, background, font, and optionally style(s), of the next block of text to display.
      Ansi Ansi.color(Ansi.Color color, Ansi.Color background, Ansi.Style... styles)
      Sets the color and background, and optionally the style(s), of the next block of text to display.
      Ansi Ansi.color(Ansi.Color color, Ansi.Font font, Ansi.Style... styles)
      Sets the color, font, and optionally the style(s), of the next block of text to display.
      Ansi Ansi.color(Ansi.Color color, Ansi.Style... styles)
      Sets the color, and optionally the style(s), of the next block of text to display.
      Ansi Ansi.color(java.awt.Color color, Ansi.Font font, Ansi.Style... styles)
      Sets the color, font, and optionally the style(s), of the next block of text to display.
      Ansi Ansi.color(java.awt.Color color, Ansi.Style... styles)
      Sets the color, and optionally the style(s), of the next block of text to display.
      Ansi Ansi.color(java.awt.Color color, java.awt.Color background, Ansi.Font font, Ansi.Style... styles)
      Sets the color, background, font, and optionally style(s), of the next block of text to display.
      Ansi Ansi.color(java.awt.Color color, java.awt.Color background, Ansi.Style... styles)
      Sets the color and background, and optionally the style(s), of the next block of text to display.
      Ansi Ansi.color(int colorIndex, Ansi.Font font, Ansi.Style... styles)
      Sets the color, font, and optionally the style(s), of the next block of text to display.
      Ansi Ansi.color(int colorIndex, Ansi.Style... styles)
      Sets the color, and optionally the style(s), of the next block of text to display.
      Ansi Ansi.color(int colorIndex, int backgroundIndex, Ansi.Font font, Ansi.Style... styles)
      Sets the color, background, font, and optionally style(s), of the next block of text to display.
      Ansi Ansi.color(int colorIndex, int backgroundIndex, Ansi.Style... styles)
      Sets the color and background, and optionally the style(s), of the next block of text to display.
      Ansi Ansi.delay()
      Helper method to delay output for a short period of time, so users can see the output changing.
      Ansi Ansi.delay(long millis)
      Helper method to delay output for a short period of time, so users can see the output changing.
      Ansi Ansi.err(java.lang.String text, java.lang.Object... args)
      Writes text to stderr after piping it and args through String.format().
      Ansi Ansi.errln()
      Simply writes a newline to stderr.
      Ansi Ansi.errln(java.lang.String text, java.lang.Object... args)
      Writes text to stderr after piping it and args through String.format(), also prints a newline.
      Ansi Ansi.fixed(int row, int column)
      Moves the cursor to a fixed position on the screen, where the top left corner is 1, 1.
      Ansi Ansi.font(Ansi.Font font, Ansi.Style... styles)
      Sets the font, and optionally the style(s), of the next block of text to display.
      Ansi Ansi.moveCursor(int lines)
      Repositions the cursor up or down a number of lines.
      Ansi Ansi.moveCursor(int lines, int columns)
      Move the cursor up or down a number of lines and left or right a number of columns.
      Ansi Ansi.out(java.lang.String text, java.lang.Object... args)
      Writes text to stdout after piping it and args through String.format().
      Ansi Ansi.outln()
      Simply writes a newline to stdout.
      Ansi Ansi.outln(java.lang.String text, java.lang.Object... args)
      Writes text to stdout after piping it and args through String.format(), also prints a newline.
      Ansi Ansi.overwriteLastLine()
      Clears the current and previous lines and positions the cursor at the start of the previous line.
      Ansi Ansi.overwriteThisLine()
      Clears the current line and positions the cursor at the start of the line.
      static Ansi Ansi.rawAnsi()
      Constructs a new Ansi instance that formats strings with the character sequences used to create escape codes.
      static Ansi Ansi.realAnsi()
      Constructs a new Ansi instance that always formats strings according to the ANSI standard, even when other environments were detected.
      Ansi Ansi.style(Ansi.Style style, Ansi.Style... styles)
      Sets the color, and optionally the style(s), of the next block of text to display.
